body: Yum, lots of changes to the tests. :)  In the tests, is it better to replace `"hsl(230,50%,100%)"` with `d3.hsl("hsl(230,50%,100%)")` rather than the raw RGB hex `"#ffffff"`?
I might tackle this nowâ€¦ I'd probably write an assertColor(expected, actual).

The only issue I really encountered was that `d3.hsl(d3.hsl(x)) == d3.hsl(x)` no longer held due to the string coercion always using RGB in d3.hsl's constructor.

I have a branch with all the tests updated to use hex RGB if that's useful, or you might just want to start from scratch. :)
[Here it is](https://github.com/jasondavies/d3/tree/rgb), with a single failing test case due to the `d3.hsl(d3.hsl(x))` issue.
OK I did some [microbenchmarking](http://jsperf.com/instanceof-vs-attribute-reference) and it looks like instanceof is fast, so I think we'll use that. It's also safer, arguably.

Hehe, I was just typing the following. Instanceof sounds good!

> Hmm, I do like the idea of being able to pass in an object that has the appropriate keys, rather than requiring a particular instance of something. But I guess it's trivial to call `d3.hsl(x.h, x.s, x.l)`, and `instanceof` is probably less brittle.
Also, note that you'd have needed `r.r != null` to catch zeroes.
Pushed to rgb branch. Will followup with 2.3.3 release.

issue.title: d3.interpolate{Color} could return a color instance, rather than a string.

repository.name: d3
repository.description: Bring data to life with SVG, Canvas and HTML. :bar_chart::chart_with_upwards_trend::tada:

issue.body: I believe it was originally implemented as returning an RGB string because previously some of the colors didn't return an RGB string when coerced. Since that was changed by cc0ae766b7d44adf47be4511d79577b59f9ef057 (#333), it should be safe and more useful for the color interpolators to return an instance of the appropriate color class.

issue.title: Color interpolators return color instances.

repository.name: d3
repository.description: Bring data to life with SVG, Canvas and HTML. :bar_chart::chart_with_upwards_trend::tada:

issue.body: Fixes #1029. Previously, these interpolators returned RGB hexadecimal strings, as the intent was for the color to be used to set attributes and styles. However, since #333, all colors return RGB hexadecimal strings when coerced to a string, so we can get the equivalent behavior by returning a color instance rather than a string. Returning a color instance is also more useful in the case where additional color manipulation (such as brighter/darker) is desired.
